Notes.Text:
The following issues are fixed by this update:

* CVE-2012-5519: privilege escalation via cross-site scripting
  and bad print job submission used to replace cupsd.conf on server (bsc#924208).
* CVE-2015-1158: Improper Update of Reference Count
* CVE-2015-1159: Cross-Site Scripting

Vulnerabilities.Description: CUPS 1.4.4, when running in certain Linux distributions such as Debian GNU/Linux, stores the web interface administrator key in /var/run/cups/certs/0 using certain permissions, which allows local users in the lpadmin group to read or write arbitrary files as root by leveraging the web interface.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Legacy 12:cups154-1.5.4-9.1

Vulnerabilities.Description: The add_job function in scheduler/ipp.c in cupsd in CUPS before 2.0.3 performs incorrect free operations for multiple-value job-originating-host-name attributes, which allows remote attackers to trigger data corruption for reference-counted strings via a crafted (1) IPP_CREATE_JOB or (2) IPP_PRINT_JOB request, as demonstrated by replacing the configuration file and consequently executing arbitrary code.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Module for Legacy 12:cups154-1.5.4-9.1

Vulnerabilities.Description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the cgi_puts function in cgi-bin/template.c in the template engine in CUPS before 2.0.3 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the QUERY parameter to help/.
